title: Calories in Baked Beans
meta_description: Discover calories in baked beans per cup and 100g, including carbs, protein, fiber, sodium details, and preparation tweaks for better nutrition tracking.
assumptions: Canned baked beans in tomato sauce, vegetarian style, standard serving (246 g per cup), drained solids.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe (e.g., added sugar or meat), serving size, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of canned baked beans provides ~295 kcal, 12 g protein, and 15 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: With added bacon (2 strips per cup)

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of baked beans?
faqs.a: About 295 kcal for one cup (246 g) of canned baked beans.

faqs.q: Are baked beans high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~15 g protein per cup, plus good fiber from beans.

faqs.q: What's the sodium content in baked beans?
faqs.a: Around 984 mg per cup; opt for low-sodium versions to reduce.

faqs.q: Do baked beans have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Typically 20 g sugars per cup from sauce; check labels for added sugars.

faqs.q: How do calories in baked beans compare to other beans?
faqs.a: Higher than plain beans due to sauce (~120 kcal/100g vs. 80-100 kcal for plain).
